TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / click the continue button to start the experiment.
notext
The bottle containing 70% ethanol is taken from the lab table.
A piece of cotton is taken from the role.
70% ethanol is sprayed on the piece of cotton.
The bottle containing 70% ethanol is replaced onto the table.
An immunized hen egg is taken from the rack.
The shell of the egg is wiped using cotton containing 70% ethanol.
The cotton ball is discarded into the waste beaker.
A forceps is taken from the beaker.
The shell of the egg is breaked using handle part of the forceps.
The cracked egg shell is removed using the tips of the forceps and is discarded in the waste beaker.
The white part of the immunized hen egg is oozed out to the waste beaker.
The middle portion of the immunized hen egg is broken using the handle of the forceps.
The forceps is replaced onto the beaker.
The yolk of the immunized hen egg is slowly poured into a 50 ml beaker and the shell is discarded into a waste beaker.
A scalpel is taken from the beaker.
The membrane surrounding the yolk is cut open using scalpel.
The scalpel is replaced onto the beaker.
A 1000 microlitre pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
Adjust the volume to 1000 microlitre.
A new tip is inserted into the pipette.
The cap of the bottle containing TBS Buffer is opened and pipetteted out 1000 microlitre of TBS Buffer.
1000 microlitre of TBS buffer is added to the beaker containing cracked egg yolk.
A glass rod is taken from the beaker.
The glass rod is wiped using cotton.
The egg yolk is properly mixed by using this sterile glass rod.
The tube labeled as Diluted egg yolk is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened.
The beaker containing Diluted egg yolk is taken from the bench top.
The diluted egg yolk is transferred to the tube and the cap of the tube is closed.
The lid of the centrifuge is opened.
The tube containing diluted egg yolk is placed in the centrifuge. Another centrifuge containing water is placed opposite to the tube for balancing.
The lid of the centrifuge is closed and set to 5000 rpm for 10 minutes.
The lid of the centrifuge is open.
After 10 minutes, the lid of the centrifuge is opened and the tube containing diluted egg yolk is taken from the centrifuge.
The tube containing diluted egg yolk is placed on the rack.
A 10ml glass pipette and a pipette pump are taken from the rack.
The glass pipette is inserted into the pipette pump.
The cap of the tube is opened and the precipitate is pipetted out.
The precipitate is discarded into a waste beaker.
Take a 1000 microlitre pipette from the stand.
Adjust the volume of the pipette to 1000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into it.
The cap of the bottle containing Dextran Sulphate is opened and pipette out 1000 microlitre of solution from it.
The cap of the tube containing diluted egg yolk is opened and dextran sulphate solution is added into it.
The tip is discarded into a waste beaker.
A fresh tip is inserted into the micropipette.
1000 microlitre of Calcium chloride solution is pipetted out from the beaker.
The cap of the tube containing diluted egg yolk is opened and calcium chloride solution is added into it.
The contents in the tube are mixed properly by gentle shaking.
After proper shaking the tube is replaced onto the rack.
A 10ml glass pipette and a pipette pump are taken from the rack.
The glass pipette is inserted into the pipette pump.
The cap of the tube is opened and the precipitate is pipetted out. Sediment is observed at the bottom of the tube.
The precipitate is discarded into a waste beaker.
A 5000 microlitre pipette is taken from the rack.
volume of the micropipette is adjusted to 4000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into it.
The cap of the bottle containing TBS Buffer is opened and pipetteted out 1000 microlitre of TBS Buffer.
notext
The lid of the centrifuge is opened.
notext
The lid of the centrifuge is closed and set to 5000 rpm for 10 minutes.
After 10 minutes, the lid of the centrifuge is opened.
The tube containing sediment and TBS buffer is taken from the centrifuge.
The tube is replaced into the rack.
A 5000 microlitre pipette is taken from the rack.
A fresh tip is inserted into it.
The cap of the centrifuge tube is opened and pipetted out the supernatant from it.
The supernatant is transferred to a 25ml beaker.
A forceps is taken the beaker.
The stir bar from the watch glass is taken with forceps.
The stir bar is slowly placed into the supernatant in the beaker.
A 5000 microlitre pipette is taken from the rack.
The volume of the micropipette is adjusted to 4000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into it.
The cap of the bottle containing saturated sodium sulphate is opened and pipetted out 4000 microlitre of solution from it.
The saturated sodium sulphate solution is added to the beaker containing supernatant.The beaker is taken from the bench top and
placed on the magnetic stirrer inside the Visicooler.
The magnetic stirrer is switched on and the door of the Visicooler is closed.The supernatant is placed in the Visicooler for 2 hours at 4 degree Celsius.
After 2 hours, the door of the Visicooler is opened, the magnetic stirrer is switched off and the beaker containing supernatant is taken from it.
The beaker is placed on the bench top.The stir bar is taken from the beaker using stir bar retriever.
The cap of the centrifuge tube labeled as Concentrated IgG is opened and the solution in the beaker is transferred to the tube.. The tube is taken from the rack.
The lid of the centrifuge is opened.
The tube labeled as Concentrated IgG which contains solution is placed in the centrifuge.centrifuge containing water is placed opposite to the tube for balancing.
The lid of the centrifuge is closed.
The centrifuge is set to 13000 rpm at 4 degree Celsius for 1 hour.
After 1 hour, the lid of the centrifuge is opened
and the tube labeled as Concentrated IgG is taken out.
The cap of the tube is opened
and the supernatant is discarded into a waste beaker.
The tube is replaced onto the rack and the pellet is observed at the bottom of the tube.
A 10ml glass pipette and a pipette pump are taken from the rack.
The pipette is inserted into the pipette pump.
The cap of the bottle containing TBS buffer is opened and pipette out 10ml of buffer from it.
The cap of the tube containing pellet is opened and 10ml TBS buffer is added into it.
The pellet in the tube is resuspended in the TBS buffer by pipetting 2-3 times.
The centrifuge tube containing resuspended pellet is kept in the icebox.
Purification of IgG Fraction by Dialysis Activation of Dialysis tubing.
A small piece of Dialysis tubing is taken from its roll.
The Dialysis tubing is placed into the beaker containing 2% Sodium bicarbonate solution and the beaker is taken from the lab table.

The lid of the boiling water bath is opened and the beaker containing Dialysis tubing and 2% Sodium bicarbonate solution is placed into it, The lid of the water bath is closed and set it for 20 minutes.
After 20 minutes, the lid of the water bath is opened and the beaker containing Dialysis tubing and 2% Sodium bicarbonate solution is taken from it using a tongs, The lid of the water bath is closed.
The beaker is replaced onto the lab table.
A forceps is taken from the beaker.
The Dialysis tubing is taken from the 2% Sodium bicarbonate solution using the forceps.
The Dialysis tubing is rinsed with distilled water.
The rinsed Dialysis tubing is again placed into the beaker containing 1mM EDTA. The beaker is taken from the lab table.
The lid of the boiling water bath is opened and the beaker containing Dialysis tubing and 1mM EDTA is placed into it. The lid of the water bath is closed and set it for 10 minutes.
After 10 minutes, the lid of the water bath is opened and the beaker containing Dialysis tubing and 1mM EDTA is taken from it using a tongs and the lid of the water bath is closed.
The beaker is replaced onto the lab table.
The Dialysis tubing is taken from the 1mM EDTA solution using forceps.
The Dialysis tubing is rinsed with distilled water.
The Distilled water bottle is replaced onto the lab table and the bottle containing 005M Tris Hcl Buffer,PH 8 is taken.
The Dialysis tubing is rinsed using 005M Tris Hcl Buffer.
The Dialysis tubing is the now Activated and is placed on the tissue paper on the lab table.
Purification of IgG Antibodies
A clamp is taken from the bench top.
The Activated Dialysis tubing is taken from the tissue paper.
The clamp is inserted on the Activated dialysis tubing at one side.
The Activated dialysis tubing is placed over the tissue paper on the bench top.
A 10ml pipette and a pipette pump are taken from the rack.
The pipette is inserted into the pipette pump.
The tube labeled as concentrated IgG is taken from the icebox.
The cap of the tube is opened and the resuspended pellet solution in the tube is pippeted out.
The Activated dialysis tubing is taken from the bench top.
The Activated Dialysis tubing is filled using the resuspended pellet solution.
The air present in the dialysing tube is squeezed out and the clamp is inserted.
The Activated Dialysis tubing containing the pellet solution is placed on the tissue paper and it is wiped gently using another tissue paper.
The Activated Dialysis tubing with pellet solution is placed on the PBS Buffer,PH 7.2.
A forceps is taken from the beaker.
A magnetic Teflon is taken from the watch glass.
The magnetic Teflon is placed in the PBS Buffer, PH 7.2 using forceps and the beaker containing PBS Buffer solution and Activated dialysing tubing is taken from the bench top.
The beaker is placed on the magnetic stirrer which is placed inside the Visicooler.
The magnetic stirrer is switched on and it is kept for 3 hours at 4 degree Celsius.
After 3 hour’s incubation, the magnetic stirrer is switched off and the beaker containing PBS Buffer and Activated Dialysis tubing is taken out.
The beaker is placed back on the bench top and the Activated dialysis tubing containing resuspended pellet solution is taken from the beaker.
The clamp is taken off from one side of the dialysis tubing.
The clamp is taken off from one side of the dialysis tubing.
A Pasteur pipette is taken from the beaker.
A Pasteur pipette is taken from the beaker, The resuspended pellet solution from the Activated dialysis tubing is pipetted out using Pasteur pipette.
The cap of the tube labeled as dialysed IgG is opened and the dialysed pellet solution is added to it.
Purification of IgG Fraction by Ion-Exchange Chromatography.
The bottle containing distilled water is taken from the lab table.
The chromatographic column is washed with distilled water.
The DEAE Cellulose slurry is taken from the bench top.
The DEAE Cellulose slurry is transferred into the column.
After pouring, the slurry is replaced onto the bench top.
The PBS buffer bottle is taken from the lab table.
The PBS buffer is poured into the column.
The PBS buffer in the column is removed into a waste beaker by removing the cap .Then the column is recapped.
The centrifuge tube containing Dialysed IgG is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and the dialysate is poured into the column.
The PBS buffer is taken from the bench top.
The buffer is again poured into the column.
The cap of the centrifuge tube labeled as Purified IgG is opened and is taken.
The waste beaker under the chromatographic column is replaced by the centrifuge tube, the cap of the column is removed and the solution is collected into the tube. After that the column is recapped.
The centrifuge tube is replaced onto the bench top and the cap of the tube is closed.
A 1000 microlitre pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
Adjust its volume to 1000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into the pipette.
1000 microlitre of PBS buffer is pippeted out from the beaker.
A cuvette for blank (labeled as B) is taken from the rack.
1000 microlitre of PBS buffer is transferred to the cuvette.
The cuvette B is placed back on the rack and the other B labeled cuvette (for Blank) is taken from the rack.
Again 1000 microlitre of PBS buffer is taken from the beaker.
1000 microlitre of PBS buffer is transferred to the cuvette.
The cuvette is placed back on the rack.
The lid of spectrophotometer is opened.
One of the B labeled cuvette is taken from the rack.
The cuvette is properly wiped using a tissue paper.
After that the cuvette is placed in one of the slit in the spectrophotometer.
The second cuvette labeled as B is taken from the rack.
The cuvette is wiped properly using a tissue paper.
The second cuvette is placed in the other slit in the spectrophotometer and the lid is closed. The spectrophotometer starts to work on pressing the enter button.
This is the graph indicating the baseline which is observed on the monitor.
The cuvette labeled as B is replaced on the rack.
A 1000 microlitre pipette is taken from the stand.
Adjust its volume to 1000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into it.
The tube labeled as purified IgG is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and 1000 microlitre of sample is pipetted out from it.
The tube is placed back on the rack.
The cuvette labeled as T (Test cuvette) is taken from the rack.
The Purified IgG is transferred into the cuvette and the cuvette is wiped properly using the tissue paper.
The T labeled cuvette is placed in the spectrophotometer and is closed. The spectrophotometer starts to work on pressing the enter button.
The resultant graph is observed on the monitor.
A 10 ml pipette and a pipette pump is taken from the stand.
The pipette is inserted into the pipette pump.
The cap of the 50% glycerol bottle is opened and 5 ml of the glycerol is pippeted out.
A cryovial is taken from the cryobox.
5 ml of 50% glycerol is transferred to the cryovial.
The cryovial is replaced on the box.
A new 10ml pipette and a pipette pump is taken from the rack.
The pipette is inserted into the pipette pump.
The tube containing Purified IgG is taken from the rack.
The cap of the tube is opened and 5 ml of Purified IgG is pipetted out.
The tube is replaced on the rack.
The cryovial is taken from the box.
The cap of the vial is opened and pours the purified IgG solution into it.
The cryovial is replaced on the cryobox.
A piece of parafilm is cut from the parafilm roll.
The outer cover is removed.
The cryovial is taken from the box.
The vial is wrapped with parafilm properly.
The wrapped cryovial which contain the sample is placed on the cryobox.
The -20 degree Freezer is opened and the cryobox with vial is kept in the freezer, The door of the freezer is closed.
